data.title: Ella Fitzgerald, Count Basie, Joe Pass, Niels
data.meta_description: Ella Fitzgerald, Count Basie, Joe Pass, Niels-Henning Ørsted Pedersen - Digital III At Montreux (Red Vinyl)
data.text:
Digital III at Montreux is a 1979 live album featuring a compilation of performances by Ella Fitzgerald, Count Basie, Niels-Henning Ørsted Pedersen, Joe Pass, and Ray Brown, recorded at the 1979 Montreux Jazz Festival. It was produced and has liner notes by Norman Granz. The cover photo is by Phil Stern.

This is one of four albums featuring Fitzgerald at the Montreux Jazz Festival and is Fitzgerald’s third Montreux appearance to be released on record. The remainder of Fitzgerald’s Montreux performance of this year was released on the 1979 album A Perfect Match.

Ella’s performance on this album won her the 1982 Grammy Award for Best Jazz Vocal Performance, Female.

Description

Pablo Live ‎– D2308223, LP, Album, Red Vinyl, US 1980 Pressing

Side 1.

1. I Cant Get Started 3:39

2. Good Mileage 7:00

3. (I Don’t Stand A) Ghost Of A Chance (With You) 3:19

4. Flying Home 7:52

Side 2.

1. I Cover The Waterfront 3:34

2. Li’l Darlin’ 4:30

3. In Your Own Sweet Way 6:51

4. Oleo 4:10

Credits:

Bass – John Clayton, Keter Betts, Niels-Henning Ørsted Pedersen

Design – Norman Granz, Sheldon Marks

Drums – Butch Miles, Mickey Roker

Engineer [Editing] – Arne Frager

Engineer [Recording] – Dave Richards

Guitar – Freddie Green, Joe Pass

Liner Notes – Norman Granz

Photography – Phil Stern

Piano – Count Basie, Paul Smith

Producer – Norman Granz

Saxophone – Bobby Plater, Charlie Fowlkes, Danny Turner, Eric Dixon, Kenny Hing

Trombone – Bill Hughes, Booty Wood, Dennis Wilson, Mel Wanzo

Trumpet – Paul Cohen, Pete Minger, Ray Brown, Sonny Cohn

Condition

Media: Mint- (M-)

Sleeve: Mint- (M-)

Matrix / Runout (Side 1): PP 2363

Matrix / Runout (Side 2): PP 2364
